question: A 60-year-old man is called for a follow-up 2 weeks after his surgery for colon cancer. During the surgery, his tumor was removed and a permanent stoma was made. What is the most likely procedure performed?
What is the investigation of choice to determine patency of the distal portion of intestine prior to a defunctioning stoma reversal surgery?
How is the immunity towards hepatitis B virus measured?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding split laceration?

answers.option: It looks like an incised wound
It can occur on the forehead
It is a type of laceration
It occurs due to sudden compression between two hard objects
It can occur on the scrotal skin

question: Which of the following is incorrect regarding a stab wound?

answers.option: It is a wedge shaped opening wound
It results from piercing with a pointed weapon
In this injury bruising around the opening of the wound is seen
It may occur with a knife

question: Which of the following is correct regarding age and color of a bruise?
Which of the following antiemetic drugs is effective in increasing gastric motility and is used in patients with diabetic gastroparesis?
A patient with a duodenal ulcer comes to the clinic with a complaint of blood in vomiting. The ulcer has eroded the posterior wall of the duodenum and ruptured which artery?

A 9-year-old child presents with a prolonged history of abdominal discomfort, bloating, constipation, weight loss, and anemia. Serological examination shows positivity for anti-endomysial antibodies. An endoscopic biopsy of the jejunum will most likely show which of the following features?
Which of the following is not related to an abrasion?

answers.option: They are caused by friction of rough object against skin

question: What defines a bruise?

answers.option: It is the extravasation of blood in the subcutaneous tissue due to blunt trauma
The weapon used can be recognized
It is caused by a blunt weapon
It may help determine the time of affliction

question: Which of the following is true regarding a migratory bruise?

answers.option: May appear away from the impact site

question: Which of the following is not true regarding a grinding laceration?

answers.option: May result from fall from height
Accompanied by extreme extravasation of blood
Caused by heavy weight with avulsion of skin from underlying tissues

question: Which of the following is incorrect for an incised wound?

answers.option: The maximum measurement of an incised wound is its length
It is always caused by a sharp weapon

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of the "food frequency questionnaire" method of obtaining food intake data?
Which of the following is an indicator of a nutritionally at-risk adult?

answers.option: Body mass index less than 25 kg/m²
Involuntary weight loss of ≥ 5% in a month
Voluntary weight gain of 6.5 kg in a month

question: A country has a growth rate (r) of 3%. Experts want to make policies for better planning and administration. For this purpose, they want to calculate the number of years needed for the population to double, based on the current growth rate. Which of the following options captures the correct population doubling time of the country, based on the given information?

A country in central Africa has high mortality and a high birth rate. The experts wish to classify the country's stage of demographic transition. Which of the following correctly captures the stage of the given country?
A patient presented to the outpatient department with reports that were positive for viral hepatitis. What type of jaundice can be seen in this patient?

answers.option: Jaundice due to sickle cell disease

question: A 47-year-old man with a history of NSAID-induced ulcers has been placed on sucralfate. Which of the following compounds is related to sucralfate?

A 49-year-old man with a history of peptic ulcer disease and gastroesophageal reflux disorder has been treated with cimetidine for approximately 20 years. He now complains of breast swelling and breast discharge. Which of the following effects is the most likely explanation for his condition?

A 56-year-old female is presented to the hospital with an altered level of consciousness. After evaluation, she is diagnosed with fulminant hepatic failure. History reveals jaundice within the recent past. What is the most likely time duration of encephalopathy to develop in this patient?

A 49-year-old male is admitted to the hospital and is showing signs of impaired neuronal function, rigidity, hyperreflexia, asterixis, and altered level of consciousness. Further history and examination reveal chronic liver disease. Which of the following is the most probable cause of these, manifestations in the patient?
Which of the following types of polyp can be classified as neoplastic?
Which of the following drugs is ineffective in combination therapy for the eradication of Helicobacter pylori infection?
Which of the following is the most important drawback of sucralfate in the treatment of duodenal ulcers?

A histologist while observing an organ of the oral cavity under a light microscope observed a transition of epithelium from stratified squamous keratinized to non-keratinized epithelium. The core of the organ was made up of muscles. Which of the following is the most likely organ that he might be observing?
In Familial Adenomatous Polyposis (FAP), which of the following gene is mutated?

A 28-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with a history of colicky abdominal pain for 6 months. Pain is usually associated with diarrhea and abdominal bloating. He denies any history of fever and weight loss. Physical examination is unremarkable. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female presents to the hospital with loose stools for 3 years. On examination, she is anemic, has glossitis, and marked weight loss. Investigations reveal Hemoglobin (Hb( 9 g/dl, mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 70. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy with biopsy shows subtotal villous atrophy with intra-epithelial lymphocyte infiltrates. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In a clinically stable patient, immediate exploratory laparotomy is indicated in which of the following conditions?
Which of the following drugs for treating hepatitis has nephrotoxic effects?

A man with chronic liver failure due to hepatitis B was brought to the hospital. His imaging reports show regenerative parenchymal nodules with fibrous bands and variable degrees of vascular shunting. Which of the following best describes the mentioned condition?
Which of the following is the effect of misoprostol on the gastrointestinal tract?
Which of the following defines a wound called Jurh Jaifah?

A family member of a patient demands the doctor to withhold crucial medical information from the patient to protect him from emotional distress. What would be the most likely way to handle the situation?

answers.option: Consult your colleagues to make a decision
Leave the room and let the nursing staff explain the situation
Document the request and keep the patient involved privately
Explain the importance of honesty and involve patient in the discussion
Comply with the family member's request to maintain trust

question: A 3-year-old male child presents with a history of constipation and abdominal distension for the last few years. The plain abdominal X-ray reveals fecal matter contained distended bowel loops. A barium study shows a transitional zone at the rectosigmoid junction. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 5-month-old child presents with a history of recurrent vomiting mostly after feed but never containing blood. He is on mother feed with alternate bottle feed. He is admitted to hospital due to vomiting. He was a full-term baby and his birth weight was 2.7 Kg. On examination, the child is irritable with a current weight of 3.1 Kg and bilateral mild crepitations. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presented to the outpatient department with a history of liver enlargement, pain, hyperbilirubinemia, and ascites. Imaging showed multiple venous thrombi in hepatic veins. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 26-year-old female is suspected of having acute appendicitis. On examination, he experiences abdominal pain during extension of right hip while lying on the left lateral posiition. Where do you suspect the location of the tip of her appendix?
Which of the following inhibits the release of gastrin from the G cells in the antrum of the stomach?

answers.option: Low pH in upper small intestine

question: Which of the following is the side effect of magnesium hydroxide on the gut?
Which of the following is the most relevant statement regarding the H2 receptor blockers?

answers.option: They cause fastest healing of duodenal ulcers
They afford most prompt relief of ulcer pain
They are most efficacious drug in inhibiting gastric acid secretion
They are commonly used drug to decrease gastric acid secretion

question: A woman presents to the emergency department with a complaint of severe abdominal pain, and constipation for a few days. She is a mother to 4 children all born via c-section. What could be the cause of her condition?
A 15-year-old boy with suspected acute appendicitis has an Alvarado score of 5-6. Which of the following would be the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

A 40-year-old male presents to the emergency department with generalized abdominal pain and board-like rigidity. He has a history of chronic NSAID use. An abdominal X-ray reveals air under the diaphragm. Which of the following conditions is most likely the cause of this patient's condition?

A 30-year-old male is brought in an unconscious state to the emergency department after a road traffic accident. After regaining consciousness, the patient realizes that he can neither feel nor move his lower limbs. On examination, the gut sounds are absent, and the doctor suspects paralytic ileus. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the patient's condition?

A 63-year-old male, who is a heavy smoker, complains of food sticking behind his sternum for the last 5 months. He has lost considerable weight and appears malnourished. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy and biopsy confirm the malignant growth. What should be assessed first before commencing the therapy?

answers.option: CT scan of abdomen and chest

question: A 50-year-old man has been working in a battery manufacturing factory for the last 10 years. Now he is complaining of weakness, abdominal colic, constipation, and difficulty in walking. On examination, he has anemia, blue lines at the junction of gums and teeth, and foot drop. Which of the following poisoning has most likely occurred in the patient?

A 20-year-old girl is working in a chemistry lab. She gets into a quarrel with her fiance, who is also working there, and she takes some poison and she develops abdominal pain, vomiting, and diarrhea. On examination, her vomitus is greenish-blue in color. Which of the following constituent is most likely to be present in the poison she consumed?
The term "ring fracture" is used to denote fracture of which of the following structures?
Which of the following is the primary impact injury in the pedestrian?

A 17-year-old man is brought to the emergency department for consumption of acid. He complained of a burning sensation in his mouth, tingling, and numbness of limbs with constricted pupils. Which of the following acids is the most probable cause of the presentation of the patient?

A young man while crossing the road is hit by the vehicle from the side and falls on the road. He is dragged for some distance. Which of the following types of abrasion on the surface of the skin is most likely to develop in this person?
Defense wounds with sharp weapons are situated in which of the following regions?
In response to undernutrition, the hypothalamus regulates the energy balance by suppressing which of the following?
An 8-year-old child is nutritionally deficient and is diagnosed to be suffering from marasmus. Which of the following is most relevant about his condition?

A 9-month-old child was admitted for the second time to a nearby tertiary care hospital in Dadu, Sindh with severe abdominal cramps, and fever. He looked pale and skinny. The yellow-colored conjunctivae showed he had jaundice. Upon biochemical estimations of his blood profile, and liver function tests his bilirubin came out to be 21 mg/dl. The child is not responding to phenobarbital and sunlight exposure therapies. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 20-year-old woman visited the tertiary hospital in Karachi. The biochemical findings showed that her conjugated serum bilirubin levels were elevated. Her skin, nails, and eyes were yellowish. Later she was diagnosed with Dubin-Johnson syndrome. What is the cause of Dubin-Johnson syndrome?

A 20-year-old man was admitted to a local hospital in Shikarpur city with Jaundice. His skin and conjunctivae were yellow. His biochemical findings showed the presence of Indirect, serum-unconjugated bilirubin (4 mg/dl), increased urine urobilinogen, and fecal stercobilinogen. However, the thymol turbidity test and liver enzyme levels were normal. What is the most likely type of jaundice the patient is suffering from?

If a country uses such a method to conduct a census that only represents people who legally "belong" to a given area in some way or another, regardless of whether they were there on the day of census. Which of the following options best expresses the above method of counting?

answers.option: Combination of De facto and De jure
De facto method with some exceptions
De jure method with some exceptions

question: A country had a sharp decline in births but that still did not bring an immediate reduction in the Natural Increase. Which one of the following options best expresses this phenomenon?

A pediatrician asks a medical student to read aloud the anthropometric measures from the file of a 3-year-old boy patient in the ward. To fulfill this task, the student will read out which of the following?
According to the Gomez classification, all cases of edema are considered which grade of Protein Energy Malnutrition (PEM)?

A mother visits the primary healthcare center with her two-year-old child and complains that the child does not eat well and is lethargic. On examination, the child has sparse easily pluckable golden-brown hair, puffy eyes, edema, relatively thin limbs, and protruded belly, along with skin rash. The child is most likely a case of which of the following?

A scientist suggested the provincial government to"establish a system to continuously monitor the dietary intake and nutritional status of selected population groups. He planned to use a variety of data-collection methods with an ultimate goal of policy formulation and action planning and improving population health". The suggestion by the scientist best corresponds to which of the following?

A 30-year-old man presented to his primary care physician the results of his recent screening, which he did for an overseas job. The lab shows the presence of Anti- Hepatitis C antibody. Which of the following further tests should be advised?

A 20-year-old man presented to the medical specialist with complaints of yellow discoloration of the eyes for one week. Along with this, he complained of a fever and vomiting. He has a history of using un-boiled water. Which of the following initial tests should be ordered?

answers.option: LFT and Serological Test for Hepatitis A & E

question: A 45-year-old man presents to the family physician with complaints of pain in the abdomen, especially in the right hypochondriac region. The pain has been associated with high-grade fever for 7 days. Ultrasound abdomen shows a liver abscess size of 10 cm x 8 cm. What treatment is recommended for his illness?

answers.option: Surgical resection of the liver abscess

question: A 16-year-old boy arrived at the medical emergency department with loose motions for six months. On examination, he appears frail and malnourished. His complete blood count (CBC) reveals HB 5 g/dl, MCV 60 fl, platelet counts 5 lacs, and WBC 4000/cubic mm. Which of the following tests is recommended to diagnose the cause of his diarrhea?

answers.option: Serum celiac disease panel (anti-tissue transglutaminase antibodies)

question: A 20-year-old man presents to the medical OPD with complaints of diarrhea, and abdominal cramps for two days. They are watery in consistency and associated with blood in stool. On examination, he has a pulse of 100/min, a B.P. of 100/70 mm temperature of 101°F, and looks dehydrated. Which of the following is the most likely organism causing his illness?

A 40-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with loss of appetite, nausea, and weight loss for the last 08 months. His lab reports reveal SGPT 120, HbeAg reactive & HBV viral load 20,000. ultrasound abdomen is unremarkable. He is diagnosed with chronic HBV infection. Which of the drugs is used as first-line treatment of chronic HBV infection?

A 38-year-old female patient with gestational amenorrhea for 32 weeks presents in the ER with a sudden development of jaundice followed by an altered level of consciousness. On examination, she is hemodynamically stable, and deeply jaundiced, but not oriented in time, place, and person. LFT shows marked Increased serum bilirubin with a marked increase in ALT, and AST levels. Which of the viral infections is more likely to be the cause of her rapid deterioration?

A 42-year-old male, smoker, obese, came to a gastroenterologist with a recurrent history of epigastric pain and retrosternal burning not responding to conventional treatment, taken for the last 4-6 weeks. He planned an upper GI endoscopy which showed reddish longitudinal lesions extending above the Z-line, and multiple biopsies were taken. Biopsy showed Columnar metaplasia in the esophagus. What is the diagnosis?

A 35-year-old woman complained of a month-long, off-and-on burning pain in her upper abdomen, which was moderately intense. She also experienced nausea and had vomited once. There were no signs of black, bloody stools, or vomiting blood. Biopsy results showed she had an H. pylori infection. What are the specific conditions needed to culture H. pylori?

Which microorganism is most likely responsible for the gram-negative bacillary infection found in the histologic evaluation of biopsy specimens from a 49-year-old woman with worsening epigastric pain and a 4-mm duodenal ulcer identified during upper endoscopy, despite no evidence of malignancy?

A hospital admitted a 16-year-old girl who had symptoms such as fever, loss of appetite, feeling sick to her stomach, throwing up, and signs of jaundice like yellowing of the skin and dark urine, as well as pale-colored stool. When her blood was tested, it showed higher levels of certain liver enzymes. Upon further Inquiry, it was discovered that she had recently eaten fast food at a nearby restaurant. Laboratory tests confirmed the presence of IgM HAV antibodies. The virus is transmitted through which of the following?
Which of the following serologic tests is most likely to be positive in patients suffering from chronic diarrhea due to celiac disease?

A 27-year-old man comes to the emergency room with symptoms of acute intestinal obstruction. Examination reveals fever and a mass in the right lower abdominal quadrant. The patient subsequently undergoes surgery, and a segmental lesion involving the terminal ileum is resected showing a thickened wall and loss of mucosal regular folds. Mesenteric adipose tissue seems to creep over bowel loops. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Salmonella typhi and Salmonella paratyphi A and B are bacteria that can cause severe illness by crossing the intestinal lining in humans, ultimately reaching the body's immune system. After an incubation period of 8 to 14 days, they trigger a systemic infection. What is the term used to quantify the level of pathogenicity of the organisms?

A 35-year-old man experienced sudden nausea, vomiting, and extensive diarrhea with watery stools, about 5 liters/day. These symptoms led to dehydration, circulatory collapse, and anuria (lack of urine production) due to the rapid loss of fluids and electrolytes. Which of the following bacterium is the most likely cause?
Which of the following is the most common primary liver cancer?

A middle-aged female has recently gone through Endoscopy due to gastroesophageal reflux disease. Metaplastic change whereby squamous epithelium is replaced by columnar epithelium due to prolonged injury occurs in which of the following?

Upon abdominal examination of a patient, the doctor finds collaterals present as dilated subcutaneous veins extending from the umbilicus toward the rib margins. Sinusoidal dilation that occurs in portal hypertension is known as?

A patient presented to the emergency room with a perforated duodenal ulcer. Ultrasound shows that the perforation is present on the posterior wall of the first part of the duodenum. Which of the following arteries could be involved in this case?
Which of the following enzymes is present on the brush border epithelium of the intestine that breaks down 1,6-glycosidic linkages?

A 42-year-old female underwent an ultrasound abdomen due to non-specific abdominal pain. Ultrasound shows a well-defined anechoic lesion in the liver with posterior acoustic enhancement. No evidence of echoes within the lesion. The given explanation best corresponds to which one of the following lesions?

A 13-year-old girl presented with severe weight loss, and recurrent episodes of diarrhea, containing blood and mucus from last year. There was also a history of lower abdominal pain as well. She has visited multiple hospitals and taken antibiotics but has not improved clinically. Her fecal calprotectin levels were highly raised. Her barium enema showed a string sign in the ileal region. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old child comes to you with complaints of recurrent diarrhea since 8 months of age. The stools are bulky and foul-smelling. He was started on a complementary diet at 6 months of age. The weight is 7 kg. His Stool DR shows numerous fat globules. What further investigation you will advise to confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: Tissue Transglutaminase IgA and serum IgA
Tissue Transglutaminase IgG and Serum IgA

question: A 5-year-old child presented with a history of abdominal distension for the last 2 weeks. He has a history of recurrent foul-smelling, bulky stools containing no blood or mucus. He was admitted to the hospital two times with the above-mentioned complaints but didn't improve. On examination, his weight was 11 Kg, height was 99 cm, edematous child with hypo and hyperpigmentation all over the body. There was no peri-orbital edema, heart sounds were audible. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 19-year-old male with a broken ankle after a fall was given hydrocodone (opioid analgesic) for pain. The patient had nausea and vomited once, and was given ondansetron to treat his nausea. What is the mechanism of action of ondansetron?
Which H2 receptor blocker has the maximum inhibitory effect on microsomal cytochrome P-450?
Which of the following are the primary mechanisms by which prostaglandins promote ulcer healing?

answers.option: Increase bicarbonate secretion in gastric juice
Augmentation of bicarbonate buffered mucus layer covering gastro-duodenal mucosa
Increased turnover of gastric mucosal cells

question: A 45-year-old male is presented complaining of vomiting off/on for one month. CT scan abdomen shows a cystic lesion in the tail of the pancreas compressing the stomach. Which of the following findings is indicative of the benign nature of the disease?

answers.option: Presence of atypical cells in cystic fluid
History of mild upper quadrant pain at least a month ago
Complex cystic lesion on endoscopic ultrasound
Cystic fluid amylase level of more than 3000 IU/L

question: A 30-year-old male presents in the emergency department with a history of severe abdominal pain. His laboratory investigation shows amylase of 3000IU/L. Which of the following prognostic factors is unfavorable for this patient?

A 38-year-old female presents in the emergency department with a history of severe pain in the epigastric region and multiple episodes of vomiting for one day and gets admitted as a case of acute pancreatitis. CT scan abdomen shows a CTSI of 8/10. After 2 days of conservative management, the pain has decreased but she is not tolerating it orally. which of the following routes is preferred for nutritional support?

A 30-year-old female experiences an acute episode of right hypochondriac pain following a meal. She has had a similar episode in the past that was managed conservatively. On examination, she holds her breath on deep palpation of the right hypochondrium. On ultrasound, there are gallstones with pericholecystic fluid present. what is the best initial step in management?

answers.option: Keep the patient NPO, start IV antibiotics and analgesic

question: A 35-year-old male presents in emergency, with severe abdominal pain since one day. He has a history of pulmonary tuberculosis one year back. On examination, his pulse is 120 beats/minute. Abdomen is tense and tender. There is free air under diaphragm in erect X-ray. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Colonoscopy and biopsy of terminal ileum

question: A 45-year-old male patient with a history of hyperlipidemia and hypertension presents to clinic for a dietary consultation. He is concerned about his risk for cardiovascular disease and wants to improve his health. You explain the importance of the omega-3 and of omega-6 PUFAs in managing inflammation and improving cardiovascular health. Which mechanism describes how increasing dietary consumption omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) in comparison to omega-6 PUFA can contribute to reducing inflammation and the risk of cardiovascular disease?

answers.option: Omega-3 PUFAS compete with the enzymes that convert arachidonic acid into eicosanoids (PG, TX, LTs)
Omega-3 PUFAs enhance the ability of platelets to release TXA2, reducing the risk of coagulation
Omega-3 PUFAs inhibit the production of arachidonic acid, a precursor to inflammatory eicosanoids
Omega-3 PUFAs promote the synthesis of arachidonic acid, inhibiting inflammatory eicosanoid production
Omega-3 PUFAS compete with the inflammatory properties imparted by omega-6 PUFAs

question: During phase 1 and 2 reactions, the liver converts xenobiotics into a soluble form to be excreted out from the body. Which enzyme is used in the phase 1 reaction?
Which of the following leads to anemia in gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD)?
A patient on tetracycline has recently started taking calcium antacids for heartburn. What will be the effect of antacids on tetracycline?
A pregnant woman in her second trimester had painless bleeding per rectum without any history of constipation or diarrhea. What could be the possible reason for the bleeding?
Collagen digestion is catalyzed by which of the following enzymes?
What is the appearance of Mallory Denk bodies?

A typical 20-year-old woman, weighing 50 kg, engaged in light exercise has an estimated total energy expenditure of 2140 Kcal per day. What percentage of calories will be consumed in resting metabolic rate?

A 65-year-old male presented to the OPD with a complaint of dysphagia, weight loss, and fatigue. Initially, there was difficulty in eating solids which then progressed to complete avoidance of solid food. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
What sign is used to check the movement of the fetus in liquor amnii?
Which of the following substances released by the stomach after taking a meal acts on the hypothalamus to regulate appetite?
An old man presented to the outpatient department with shortness of breath, palpitations, and slight chest pain. Which of the following types of activity should be recommended to him?
The weight of a child doubles upon reaching which of the following ages?
In road traffic accidents, what is the injury called when a vehicle hits an object on the road?

A kid who has not been eating for the last one month develops diarrhea. On physical examination, he looks weak and pale. He has generalized edema, an enlarged liver, and a distended stomach. His investigations revealed hemoglobin (Hb): 6.5 g/dL, protein: 3.2 mg/dL, and albumin: 2.0 g/dL. What is the diagnosis?
A patient with a history of alcohol abuse now has grade 3 fibrosis in the liver. Which of the following histopathological features will be observed in this patient?
As a child grows up, both growth and development are observed. What is meant by development?

answers.option: Increase in cognitive, social, and functional skills

question: Which of the following drugs is an irritant that enhances gastric motility?
Which of the following tests is advised to a patient with shrunken, nodular liver and hypersplenism?
Which of the following drugs affects gastric juice volume and motility, but not acid and pepsin?

A 45-year-old male is a known case of hepatitis C. He presents to the clinic with ascites, and jaundice for 2 weeks. He has a history of similar episodes in the past. Which of the following correctly correlates with his condition?
Christison's saying is for which of the following acids?

A mother brought a child to the OPD for a health checkup. The doctor noted his age, weight, and height. His weight was low compared to normal weight for that age. In which of the following would this child be correctly classified?
Which of the following classifies as osmotic diarrhea?
A female who is a known case of hypertension visited a nutritional consultant. Which of the following diets would the consultant recommend for this patient?

A student was given a microscopic slide to identify a structure. On histological observation, this structure had simple squamous epithelium below and stratified columnar epithelium above. The submucosa of this structure had large veins surrounding it. Which of the following structures could the student be observing?
What is the daily calcium requirement for pregnant women?
Which of the following is the Rockall score used for?
Which of the following differentiates between femoral and inguinal hernia?
A crush injury during a vehicular accident most commonly ruptures which organ?
A patient presented to you with a stab wound with a square object like a screw driver. Which of the following will be the shape of the wound?

A 2-year-old child who is tachypneic, and irritable, has increased WBCs, and increased CRP. Abdominal and chest X-rays are unremarkable. A mass is palpable on the right side of the abdomen. Further inquiry reveals that the patient experiences per rectal bleeding. Which of the following could the diagnosis be?
Which of the following can be given in acute liver failure?
